properties.name: CCWC-BOG-00
properties.locName: Bog drainage upstream of Kebler Pass Road and Coal Creek

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-01
properties.locName: Gossan and Keystone hill-slope drainage; sampled on the south side of Kebler Pass Road.

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-OPP-1
properties.locName: First unnamed tributary downstream of BOG-00 above Kebler Pass Rd; sample collected about 5 m above rd. The site is approximately 100 m downstream of BOG-00 and 55 m upstream of CULVERT #1. The water drains from a breached area on the fen ditch.

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-OPP-2
properties.locName: Second unnamed tributary/seep downstream of BOG-00 above Kebler Pass Road; sample collected about 5 m above rd.  The site is approximately 135 m downstream of BOG-00 and about 20 m above CULVERT #2. The water drains from a breached area on the fen ditch.

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-OPP-3
properties.locName: Third unnamed tributary downstream of BOG-00 above Kebler Pass Rd;  collected about 5 m above rd.  Flows from BOG-OPP-1, BOG-OPP-2, & BOG-OPP-3 combine in the ditch immediately above CULVERT #3. The water drains from a breached area on the fen ditch.

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-OPP-4
properties.locName: Drainage from the eastern portion of the wetland below the Fen Ditch. This tributary may provide flow to the lower BOG-OPP sites.

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-OPP-5
properties.locName: Drainage from the western portion of the wetland below the Fen Ditch. This tributary may provide flow to the lower BOG-OPP sites.

properties.name: CCWC-BOG-WT
properties.locName: Bog tributary above the fen ditch.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-00
properties.locName: Coal Creek above pedestrian bridge on Butte Ave.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-01
properties.locName: Coal Creek at Totem Pole Park below the bridge and stormwater discharge

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-02
properties.locName: Coal Creek above Crested Butte and below irrigation diversions

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-05
properties.locName: Coal Creek below Wildcat Trail bridge

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-06
properties.locName: Coal Creek above Wildcat Trail Bridge and below the Crested Butte water supply intake and the Keystone waste water treatment plant outfall

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-10
properties.locName: Coal Creek below Crested Butte water supply intake and above the Keystone WWTP Outfall

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-10.5
properties.locName: Coal Creek below input from KEY-CULVERT- which drains road and western portion of Keystone Mine Property.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-10.75
properties.locName: Coal Creek above input from KEY_CULVERT- which drains road and western portion of Keystone Mine.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-11
properties.locName: Coal Creek above Crested Butte water supply intake and Keystone WTP Outfall.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-12
properties.locName: Coal Creek above the Mount Emmons Iron Fen and Gossan.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-15
properties.locName: Coal Creek below confluence with Elk Creek

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-1.5
properties.locName: Coal Creek at the first street bridge in Crested Butte, CO. Water quality samples are collected above the bridge and flow measurements are completed below the bridge at the staff gauge.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-20
properties.locName: Coal Creek above Elk Creek

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-22
properties.locName: Coal Creek about 50 meters above Splains Gulch Road, where the chip seal ends. Location established for the Kebler Pass Road magnesium chloride investigation.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-25
properties.locName: Coal Creek below the confluence of Anthracite and Ruby Creeks, below  junction of roads to Lake Irwin, Ohio Creek and Kebler Pass summit.

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-26
properties.locName: North fork of Coal Creek near Kebler Pass "Y"

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-27
properties.locName: North fork of Coal Creek just upstream of Kebler Pass "Y"

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-30
properties.locName: Coal Creek below Irwin town site and the Forest Queen Mine

properties.name: CCWC-COAL-32
properties.locName: The largest/main tributary of Coal Creek, approximately 75 yards downstream of the last man-made Forest Queen Mine pond and below the Irwin Townsite.

properties.name: CCWC-CULVERT #1
properties.locName: First culvert downstream of BOG-00 and immediately below BOG-OPP-3. The culvert recieves flow from BOG-OPP-1, BOG-OPP-2, and BOG-OPP-3.  The culvert goes under Kebler Pass rd at BOG-OPP-3. The culvert is black corrugated plastic.

properties.name: CCWC-CULVERT #2
properties.locName: CULVERT #2 is about 190 m down from CULVERT #1. There are not typically surface tributaries between CULVERT #1 and CULVERT #2.  Groundwater seeps from the road cut-slope and water that by-passed CULVERT #1 create the flow at CULVERT #2.

properties.name: CCWC-CULVERT #3
properties.locName: Third culvert below BOG-00. There are not typically tributaries between CULVERT #2 & CULVERT #3. Groundwater seeps & dispersed surface flow create flow in the ditch immediatley downstream of CULVERT #2.

properties.name: CCWC-CULVERT #5
properties.locName: The fifth culvert downstream of BOG-00. There are two tributaries between CULVERT #4 and CULVERT #5. The second tributary accounts for about 80 percent of the flow at CULVERT #5. The second tributary likely drains a portion of the Gossan.

properties.name: CCWC-EC-01
properties.locName: Discharge at lower collapsed adit of Elk Creek mine

properties.name: CCWC-EC-02
properties.locName: Discharge at toe of Elk Creek Mine wasterock pile

properties.locName: Elk Creek near mouth above Kebler Pass Road and Coal Creek

properties.name: CCWC-FQM-Pond 2

properties.name: CCWC-FQM-Pond 3

properties.name: CCWC-FQM-Pond 4

properties.name: CCWC-FQM-Pond 5

properties.name: CCWC-FQM-Pond 7
